name: Hydrogen
description: Hydrogen is the lightest and most abundant element in the universe. It is a colorless, odorless, non-metallic, monatomic gas with the element symbol H and atomic number 1.

name: Lithium
description: Lithium is a soft, silvery-white alkali metal. It is the lightest metal and the lightest solid element under standard conditions.

name: Sodium
description: Sodium is a soft, silvery-white, highly reactive metal. It is an alkali metal and belongs to group 1 of the periodic table.

name: Potassium
description: Potassium is a soft, silvery-white, very reactive alkali metal. It oxidizes rapidly in air and reacts violently with water.

name: Beryllium
description: Beryllium is a hard, grayish-white, brittle, alkaline earth metal element. It has one of the highest melting points among the light metals.

name: Magnesium
description: Magnesium is a shiny gray, light alkaline earth metal. It is the eighth most abundant element in the Earth's crust and is essential for all living cells.

name: Scandium
description: Scandium is a soft, silvery-white transition metal. It develops a yellowish or pinkish tint when exposed to air.

name: Titanium
description: Titanium is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density, and high strength. It is corrosion-resistant.

name: Iron
description: Iron is a metal of the first transition series. It is the most common element on Earth (by mass) and the main component of the Earth's core.

name: Copper
description: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.

name: Aluminum
description: Aluminum is a silvery-white, soft, non-magnetic, ductile metal. It is the third most abundant element in the Earth's crust.

name: Tin
description: Tin is a silvish-white lustrous, relatively soft and malleable heavy metal. It has been used since the Bronze Age.

name: Silicon
description: Silicon is a hard, brittle crystalline metalloid with a blue-grey metallic lustre. It is a semiconductor.

name: Germanium
description: Germanium is a lustrous, hard, grayish-white metalloid in the carbon group. It is a semiconductor material.

name: Carbon
description: Carbon is a nonmetallic element and the fundamental building block of life on Earth. It forms millions of compounds.

name: Nitrogen
description: Nitrogen is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, and largely inert gas. It makes up 78% of Earth's atmosphere.

name: Oxygen
description: Oxygen is a colorless, odorless, tasteless gas. It is the most abundant element in Earth's crust and is essential for respiration.

name: Fluorine
description: Fluorine is a pale yellow, toxic, corrosive gas with a pungent odor. It is the most reactive and electronegative element.

name: Chlorine
description: Chlorine is a yellow-green, toxic gas with a pungent odor. It is used for disinfecting drinking water and in swimming pools.

name: Helium
description: Helium is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert monatomic gas. It has the lowest boiling point of all elements.

name: Neon
description: Neon is a colorless, odorless inert gas. It is used in neon signs and gives a characteristic red-orange light.

name: Argon
description: Argon is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert gas. It is the most abundant noble gas in Earth's atmosphere.

name: Lanthanum
description: Lanthanum is a soft, ductile, silvery-white metal that tarnishes slowly when exposed to air. It is the eponymous element of the lanthanides.

name: Cerium
description: Cerium is a soft, ductile, silvery-white metal. It is the most abundant of the rare earth elements and is used in flints for lighters.

name: Actinium
description: Actinium is a radioactive, silvery metal. It is the eponymous element of the actinide series and glows blue in the dark.

name: Uranium
description: Uranium is a hard, dense, radioactive metal with a silvery-white color. It is the last naturally occurring element in the periodic table.
